Both films are sure to offer you an enjoyable viewing experience!

Both "The Best Years of Our Lives" and "The Patriot" might be a good fit for you, as they both delve into the lives of veterans returning home after war, exploring themes similar to what you mentioned with Red Cliff.

In "The Best Years of Our Lives," three World War II veterans must navigate their changed families and lives upon returning home, while in "The Patriot," a farmer is compelled to lead the Colonial Militia during the American Revolution after a personal tragedy. These films offer powerful portrayals of the human experience amidst war and its impact on individuals and society. Enjoy!
